definition: dialect/language/spoken words/speech/talk/words/conversation/what sb said/CL:種|种[zhong3],席[xi2],句[ju4],口[kou3],番[fan1]
affair/business/matter/to be engaged in/to attend to/by all means

sentences.english: It is indicates whether current external line is an attendant.
sentences.chinese: 它指示當前的外線是否爲自動話務員。

sentences.english: I should ask the operator when the most economical time would be.
sentences.chinese: 我應向話務員問清何時打電話最便宜。

sentences.english: Have you worked as a telephonist ?
Operator, you give me a wrong number.
sentences.chinese: 話務員，你給我接錯電話了。

sentences.english: The Emergency Group Leader will inform the case to telephone operator.
sentences.chinese: 緊急應變小組長將情況通知話務員。

sentences.english: A telephonist is supposed to have local knowledge.
sentences.chinese: 話務員應該熟悉當地的情況。

sentences.english: Operator, we are disconnected before I finished talking .
sentences.chinese: 話務員，我還沒講完話就斷線了。

sentences.english: Subscriber can live record three sections of computer telephonist reminder tone.
sentences.chinese: 用戶可自行現場錄製三段電腦話務員提示語音。

sentences.english: But the problem is my telephonist must have local knowledge as well.
sentences.chinese: 但問題是話務員還必須有關於當地情況的學問。
話務員給我們接通了電話。
